meanings.definition: The quality or state of being historical.
meanings.sent1: The historicities of ancient civilizations fascinate me.
meanings.sent2: Scholars delve into the historicities of past empires to understand their rise and fall.
meanings.sent3: The historicities of my family tree reveal surprising connections to famous figures.
meanings.sent4: The historicities of folklore often blur the line between fact and fiction.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the historicities of World War II brings the past to life in vivid detail.

meanings.definition: The study or knowledge of historical events.
meanings.sent1: Her passion for historicities led her to pursue a degree in history.
meanings.sent2: Historians dedicate their lives to uncovering the historicities of the past.
meanings.sent3: The class on historicities made learning about the past surprisingly fun.
meanings.sent4: In the library, shelves overflow with books on historicities waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: Visiting museums allows us to immerse ourselves in the historicities of different eras.

meanings.definition: The historical authenticity or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: Doubts were raised about the historicities of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent2: Researchers strive to verify the historicities of the documents they uncover.
meanings.sent3: The movie's historicities were questioned by critics due to inaccuracies.
meanings.sent4: His story had a ring of historicities that made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent5: The historicities of the legend were debated among historians for years.
